title: Peking duck stir-fried rice
description: Experience a taste of the orient with this super quick Peking duck stir-fried rice. Speedy but satisfying, a perfect meal if you’re in a hurry.
ingredients: ½ x 200g pack free-range duck mini fillets
½ x 90g pack baby pak choi, leaves separated
240g pack Tilda Stir Fry Peking Rice
7.5cm piece of cucumber, sliced and cut into thin strips

method.Step 1: Heat a wok until hot, add the olive oil, then add the duck and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.

method.Step 2: Return the wok to the heat, add the sugar snaps and pak choi and 1 tbsp of water. Stir-fry for 1 minute, remove from the pan and set aside with the duck.

method.Step 3: Add the rice to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding 1-2 tbsp water if it begins to stick.

method.Step 4: Return the vegetables and duck to the pan along with the spring onions. Toss it all together, taste and adjust the seasoning, then add plum sauce to taste.

method.Step 5: Divide between two bowls and serve topped with strips of cucumber and a sprinkling of chopped peanuts.
